column3:
@jonasschnelli Could you check if `clock5.png` displays correctly?

Edit: Fixed, see commit.
Nice! Thanks.\nWill test and post some screenshots soon.\n
Where did the "something new" network icon come from? What is its license? This needs to be updated in assets-attribution.md, and must be MIT or similar licensing terms.\n

In general it looks very good. The new net icons (instead of the "wifi" like icon) has a bit thin lines... Please update the `assets-attribution.md`. At least add yourself to the list of designers (https://github.com/MarcoFalke/bitcoin/blob/MarcoFalke-2015-icon-cleanup/doc/assets-attribution.md#jonas-schnelli) so it would be clear that you are publishing under the MIT license. OSX:
I'm not a friend of the new connection symbols, that is a NACK on changing it that way.\n

@Diapolo: could you give us any objective reasons for your dislike? The current icon is mostly used for WiFi connections and therefore i think changing it makes sense. The new icons would more reflect a p2p "signal strength".\n
I will try to make the wires thicker and make another commit of the new p2p-connection symbol, so it is easier not to merge it.\n
@jonasschnelli It reminds me of an USB-like symbol, a USB hub or something. Perhaps we should only use a color indicator red, orange, yellow and green (only if incoming connections are allowed).\n

I like the new connection icon. Inventive.

NACK on using a color indicator. We've switched to single-color icons, let's stick to it.

I did the split into two commits, so we have:
- First commit:

![screenshot from 2015-08-04 12-29-13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6399679/9063124/56ac30c6-3ac6-11e5-8a57-8eacd2e2b26a.png)
- Second commit (thicker wires):

![screenshot from 2015-08-04 16-14-19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6399679/9063181/934ede2a-3ac6-11e5-99da-989170c10d2d.png)

Post merge ACK. I did have some screens to post but will leave it now.

On Friday, August 7, 2015, Wladimir J. van der Laan <
